page.title: 09Derelict Land
page.content: Two industries have left their mark on the land, namely quarrying and tin-streaming, the former being fairly prominent. There are 5 derelict quarry sites, some having been worked into the late 1950s. As well as the excavations produced by quarrying, there are large heaps of waste material. Some are in rather isolated places, with the remains of tracks leading to them. There instances of partly-finished blocks of granite lying around. One quarry adjacent to the former Yelverton-Princetown railway, the track of which is easily discernible, provides a popular route for walking on the moors. The quarry had its own sidings. Tin streaming is evident along the sides of the watercourses by the waste thrown aside by the men working this method of winning tin.
